meanings.definition: To tear or pull something apart forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind was uptearing the leaves from the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: She was uptearing the old wallpaper to reveal the fresh paint underneath.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy enjoyed uptearing the newspaper into tiny shreds.
meanings.sent4: The tornado was uptearing everything in its path, leaving destruction behind.
meanings.sent5: The angry child was uptearing the pages of his coloring book in a fit of rage.

meanings.definition: The act of tearing something apart forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The uptearing of the fabric was a result of the rough handling.
meanings.sent2: The uptearing of the poster was a sign of a struggle in the room.
meanings.sent3: The uptearing of the paper bag caused a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The uptearing of the document was accidental, but the damage was done.
meanings.sent5: The uptearing of the cardboard box revealed the hidden treasure inside.
